thread.title: Bali flight delays continue into weekend
thread.title_full: Bali flight delays continue into weekend

title: Bali flight delays continue into weekend
text:
FORGET those luxury villas. There’s a spectacular place in Fiji and to get there you must pass through a village of 300 locals hidden in the middle of a rainforest. Travel Updates Jetstar and Virgin Australia have cancelled flights in and out of Bali by: What are these? No going home ... a passenger sitting on her luggage waits for her flight at Ngurah Rai International Airport in Bali. Picture: AP Photo/Firdia Lisnawati Source: AP 
FLIGHT in and out of Bali have been cancelled as volcanic ash continues to spew from the Mount Raung volcano, with travellers being warned the delays could extend through the weekend. 
Both Jetstar and Virgin Australia said on Friday they are monitoring the situation and will continue to keep customers updated on any new information. 
“We will continue to closely monitor the movement of the ash cloud and update customers if continued poor flying conditions lead to further cancellations throughout the day,” Jetstar said in a statement on Friday. 
The Bureau of Meteorology predicts the current conditions will linger over the next few days. Deadly ash cloud ... Mount Raung has been emitting ash since late June. Picture: AFP Source: AFP
